net.dragondelve.customdriversutil.tools.generator

Class RandomValueGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.dragondelve.customdriversutil.tools.generator.RandomValueGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueGenerator

    public class RandomValueGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ValueGenerator
    Generates values for each of the double parameters of the driver ranging from 0 to 1, or a floor and ceiling values that are passed to it. This generator uses Random to generate all values. You don't have to call nextDriver() as it does not change the nature of values provided with each driver. Instead, it just generates values based on pseudo random numbers.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double ceiling
      Maximum value that will be generated by the generator.
      private double floor
      Minimum value that will be generated by the generator.
      private java.util.Random random
      Pseudo random generator used to generate all values.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void nexDriver()
      Does nothing, as it's not necessary to inform this generator that the values are now being generated for another driver.
      double nextValue()
      Generates a random double between floor and ceiling (0.0 and 1.0 by default)

      Semi Lightweight mutator method.

      • nexDriver

        public void nexDriver()
        Does nothing, as it's not necessary to inform this generator that the values are now being generated for another driver.

      • setLimits

        public void setLimits(double floor,
                      double ceiling)
        Semi Lightweight mutator method.
        Specified by:
        setLimits in interface ValueGenerator
        Parameters:
        floor - Minimum value for any value generated by this generator cannot exceed 1.0 and can't be below 0.
        ceiling - Maximum value generated by this generator. Has to be positive and cannot exceed 1.0.
